ur_rna.StructureEditor.models

Class RnaScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • ur_rna.StructureEditor.models.RnaScene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class RnaScene
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Encompases all the information needed to an RNA "scene" which can include one or more strands of RNA in a specific 2D layout.

      • buildStrandIndex

        public int[] buildStrandIndex(int start,
                              int gapBetweenStrands)
        Creates a lookup-index where element[I] is the starting nuclotide index of the nucleotide belonging to strand[I]. For example: 3 strands with size 10, 5, and 8: buildStrandIndex(0, 0) => int[] { 0, 10, 15 } .. i.e. nucs: { S1{0-9}, S2{10-14}, S3{15-22} } buildStrandIndex(0, 3) => int[] { 0, 13, 21 } .. i.e. nucs: { S1{0-9}, S2{13-17}, S3{21-28} } buildStrandIndex(1, 3) => int[] { 1, 14, 22 } .. i.e. nucs: { S1{1-10}, S2{14-18}, S3{22-29} }
        Parameters:
        start - The desired index of the first nucleotide in the first strand.
        gapBetweenStrands - The number of index positions to skip between strands (i.e. if inter-molecular linkers need to be inserted)
        Returns:
        An integer array with each element[I] equal to the overall position of the first nucleotide in strand[I]
